manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: The Girls with No Names Find Me in Havana The Stolen Book of Evelyn Aubrey More from Serena Burdick ✓

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well written book which captured this reader
reviews.reviewText: Serena Burdick's tightly crafted story moves between England in the late 1800s and California in the early 2000s, exploring the lives of two fascinating women. It's a story of love, betrayal and mystery. It's full of raw emotions and family secrets. While I wanted to learn the answers to the Aubrey family's past, I didn't want the book to end. A great read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Cleverly written and executed
reviews.reviewText: Deep,thought provoking historical mystery book on what one will do when pushed to their limit, when choices have been taken from them and desperation is all you have. Sometimes in youth one may choose the wild, unpredictable partner, only to later regret those choices, even leading to death. The book follows the lives of two women centuries apart on a journey of discovery, trying to be their authentic selves, but coming upon roadblocks around each bend. Evelyn and Abby each seek acceptance, answers, and new beginnings. Each venturing away from those who are familiar to uncover who they may become. One journeys to America in the late 1800’s to finally have a voice, the other to England in present day, for answers and resolutions. Evelyn’s marries the wrong man. Her gift of prose is stolen by her abusive and vile husband and claimed as his own in a time where wives were little more than property. Abby, in current times, seeks to find the father she has never known, and discovers a gift that will heal the holes left in her. This book will find you full of emotions ranging from disgust and unbelief to cheering for pure cleverness , and intrigue to finally frustration of timing throughout the histories of both women. The one thing it won’t find, is you putting it down until the last page.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I couldn’t put it down
reviews.reviewText: Great story with well developed, complex characters. Evelyn and Abigail suffered but in the end found a path to a happiness. There was a lot of tragedy throughout the book but the story was engaging and well written. Loved it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The author would benefit from working on showing and not telling. Seriously… don’t you think the conversation where William threatens the heroine’s financial security and the rights to see her son should have been spelled out for the reader instead of a sentence of after thought?Other than a few inconsistencies and way too many “coincidences”, the author can spin a plot, but be prepared for a miserable, shallow “heroine” who needs drugs to function, is too weak to stand up for herself in front of anybody, takes advantage of a gentle former fiancé to meet her own selfish needs, can’t stand her own baby but has a relationship with a five to ten year old neighbor kid with whom she discusses modern literature….Yeah… it didn’t work for me either. I found no redeeming qualities in her and could have cared less if she was successful. In the face of such a miserable, whiny character, the weak appeal to feminism flops miserably.The modern day heroine was a little more like able and at least gave us a happily ever after.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very good, but not great
reviews.reviewText: I liked the characters of Evelyn and Abby, but Abby’s journey to find her father was not really that believable, as things were resolved too easily.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Great Read Start to Finish
reviews.reviewText: The story was captivating. I enjoyed the twist and turns as I read. Each time I put the book down, I looked forward to reading more of it. Definitely, worth a read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Extremely interested about books with the theme about “Books”, if that makes sense.
reviews.reviewText: This story left me reading far past my bedtime, but was soooo worth it. I will be reading this author’s other books for sure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The plot twists and turns and covers 120 plus years of family history so that Abby can finally meet her father. From California to England and back by way of New Hampshire Abby covers a lot of geography. I thoroughly enjoyed this historical novel and hope you do too.
